clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Diclofenac for Patients With Acute Submassive Pulmonary Embolism: a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective is to demonstrate the clinical benefits of diclofenac (added to standard anticoagulant therapy) over placebo in normotensive patients with acute symptomatic pulmonary embolism and right ventricular dysfunction.
The secondary objective is to assess the safety after administration of diclofenac in normotensive patients with acute symptomatic pulmonary embolism and right ventricular dysfunction.

primary_outcome.measure: Right ventricular dysfunction assessed by transthoracic echocardiography
primary_outcome.time_frame: 36-48 hours after administration of the first dose of diclofenac/placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Right ventricular dysfunction assessed by transthoracic echocardiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Seven days after administration of diclofenac/placebo
